text: You Young-min (Korean: 유영민; Hanja: 兪英民; born 27 August 1951) is a South Korean politician previously served as President Moon Jae-in's first Minister of Science and ICT. He has worked at ICT-related fields in private enterprise, academia and government. After graduating in mathematics from Pusan National University, he started working at LG Electronics's computing department. Before entering politics in 2016 for its general election, he held senior managerial roles in major corporations in South Korea or their subsidiaries such as chief information officer of LG Electronics, vice president of LG CNS and chief operating officer of POSCO ICT. He led several government-funded institutes as the 4th president of now-National IT Industry Promotion Agency, vice president of Korean Institute of Information Scientists and Engineers and chief director of now-Korea Data Agency. He was a board member of G-Star organising committee from 2006 to 2007. == Awards == * 30x30px Order of Industrial Service Merit by the government of South Korea (2005) == Electoral history == {| class="wikitable" !Election !Year !District !Party Affiliation !Votes !Percentage of votes !Results |- |20th National Assembly General Election |2016 |Busan Haeundae A |Democratic Party |40,563 |41.01% |Lost |- |21st National Assembly General Election |2020 |Busan Haeundae A |Democratic Party |49,633 |37.3% |Lost |} == References == Category:Living people Category:1951 births Category:People from Busan Category:Pusan National University alumni Category:Minjoo Party of Korea politicians Category:South Korean politicians Category:Science ministers Category:Government ministers of South Korea
title: You Young-min
